SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.unvired.database
Interface IDataManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
DataManagerImpl, GlassDataManagerImpl
public interface IDataManager

IDataManager provides access to the application's database. IDataManager provides methods to get, insert, modify and delete data into / from the database. IDataManager deals with data in terms of Java Objects - . IDataManager also allows execution of custom SQL statements. All methods which allow execution of custom SQL statements start with 'execute'.

How to get access to IDataManager: Use to get access to the IDataManager. Example: {@code: ApplicationManager applicationManager = ApplicationManager.getInstance(); IDataManager dataManager = applicationManager.getDataManager(); SQLite is used as the underlying database.

dropDatabase

void dropDatabase()
                  throws DBException
Executes a set of database insert / modify / delete operations in a transaction. Provides exclusive access to the database and ensures that there are no nested transactions due to different threads trying to start separate transactions. Set of database operations which need to be part of the transaction has to be implemented in the interface ITransactable and provided as a parameter to executeTransaction.

 Example:
ITransactable transaction = new ITransactable() {
		
			public boolean transaction(IDataManager dataManager) throws DBException {
				dataManager.insert(dataStructure1);
				dataManager.insert(dataStructure2);
				dataManager.insert(dataStructure3);
				...
				return true;
			}
		};
		
		dataManager.executeTransaction(transaction);

Parameters:
callback - Database operations grouped in the implementation of the interface ITransactable
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

insert

void insert(IDataStructure dataStructure)
            throws DBException
Insert the IDataStructure into the database. Create an instance of the IDataStructure (implementation). Set the required fields. Insert the data structure.

Parameters:
dataStructure - Data Structure (header or item / structure) that is to be inserted in the database
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

insertOrUpdateBasedOnGID

void insertOrUpdateBasedOnGID(IDataStructure dataStructure)
                              throws DBException
Inserts or updates the IDataStructure into the database. Data structure is identified based on the GID fields in the data model and if it exists the data structure is updated, otherwise inserted. Convenience method used when it is not known if the data structure is already existing in the database.

Parameters:
dataStructure - Data Structure (header or item / structure) that is to be inserted / updates in the database
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

void delete(IDataStructure dataStructure)
            throws DBException
Delete the data structure from the database.

Parameters:
dataStructure - Data Structure (header or item / structure) that is to be inserted / updates in the database
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

delete

void delete(java.lang.String structureName)
            throws DBException
Deletes all rows in the table.

Parameters:
structureName - Table where data should be deleted.
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

delete

void delete(java.lang.String structureName,
            java.lang.String whereClause)
            throws DBException
Deletes all rows in the table that satisfy the where clause. Where clause has to be manually constructed with the correct keywords supported by the database. Ex: WHERE sales_order_status = '1' AND customer_no = 'abc'

Parameters:
structureName - Table where data should be deleted.
whereClause - Where clause to filter the rows
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

update

void update(IDataStructure dataStructure)
            throws DBException
Update the IDataStructure into the database. Update an instance of the IDataStructure (implementation). Set the required fields. Update the data structure. The data structure can be obtained using get(..) methods before updating.

Parameters:
dataStructure - Data Structure (header or item / structure) that is to be updated in the database
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

update

void update(java.lang.String structureName,
            java.lang.String[] columnNames,
            java.lang.Object[] columnValues,
            java.lang.String whereClause)
            throws DBException
Update the table rows' columns with the provided values based on the where clause. Where clause has to be manually constructed with the correct keywords supported by the database. Ex: WHERE sales_order_status = '1' AND customer_no = 'abc'

Parameters:
structureName - Table required to be updated
columnNames - Array of column names that has to be updated
columnValues - Array of column values for the column names
whereClause - Where clause to filter the rows
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

get

IDataStructure[] get(java.lang.String structureName)
                     throws DBException
Get data from the database as IDataStructure objects for the given table name.

Parameters:
structureName - Table name from where data has to be fetched
Returns:
IDataStructure[] Array of data structure objects from the table
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

get

IDataStructure[] get(java.lang.String structureName,
                     java.lang.String[] orderByFields)
                     throws DBException
Get data from the database as IDataStructure objects for the given table name. The data structures are ordered by the fields provided in the array.

Parameters:
structureName - Table name from where data has to be fetched
orderByFields - String[] Array of fields to order the data fetched from the database. If there are multiple fields then the data is ordered according to the array index.
Returns:
IDataStructure[] Array of data structure objects from the table
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

get

IDataStructure[] get(java.lang.String structureName,
                     java.lang.String whereClause)
                     throws DBException
Get data from the database as IDataStructure objects for the given table name. Data is fetched based on the 'where clause'. 'where clause' should NOT contain the key word 'where'. Note all values have to be within single quotes. 
Example for 'where clause':
 // Raw code
  String whereClause = "SALES_ORDER_TYPE = 'ABC' AND TOTAL_AMOUNT > '10000'";
  
  // Using some constants
  String whereClause = SALES_ORDER_HEADER.SALES_ORDER_TYPE  + " = '" + AppConstants.SALES_ORDER_STANDARD_TYPE + "' AND" 
  					SALES_ORDER_HEADER.TOTAL_AMOUNT + " > '" + totalAmount + "'";

Parameters:
structureName - Table name from where data has to be fetched
whereClause - Where clause to filter data
Returns:
IDataStructure[] Array of data structure objects from the table
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

get

IDataStructure[] get(java.lang.String structureName,
                     java.lang.String whereClause,
                     java.lang.String[] orderByFields)
                     throws DBException
Get data from the database as IDataStructure objects for the given table name. The data structures are ordered by the fields provided in the array. Data is fetched based on the 'where clause'. The data structures are ordered by the fields provided in the array. 'where clause' should NOT contain the key word 'where'. Note all values have to be within single quotes. 
Example for 'where clause':
  // Raw code
  String whereClause = "SALES_ORDER_TYPE = 'ABC' AND TOTAL_AMOUNT > '10000'";
  
  // Using some constants
  String whereClause = SALES_ORDER_HEADER.SALES_ORDER_TYPE  + " = '" + AppConstants.SALES_ORDER_STANDARD_TYPE + "' AND" 
  					SALES_ORDER_HEADER.TOTAL_AMOUNT + " > '" + totalAmount + "'";

Parameters:
structureName - Table name from where data has to be fetched
whereClause - Where clause to filter data
orderByFields - String[] Array of fields to order the data fetched from the database. If there are multiple fields then the data is ordered according to the array index.
Returns:
IDataStructure[] Array of data structure objects from the table
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

getChildren

IDataStructure[] getChildren(java.lang.String structureName,
                             IDataStructure headerDataStructure)
                             throws DBException
Get all the children structures / items from the child table for the give header data structure. Ex: Get sales order items from table sales_order_items based on sales order header.

Parameters:
structureName - Table name from where data has to be fetched
headerDataStructure - Header data structure
Returns:
IDataStructure[] Array of data structure objects from the table
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

getChildren

IDataStructure[] getChildren(java.lang.String structureName,
                             java.lang.String whereClause,
                             java.lang.String[] orderBy,
                             IDataStructure headerDataStructure)
                             throws DBException
Get all the children structures / items from the child table for the give header data structure. Ex: Get sales order items from table sales_order_items based on sales order header. The data structures are ordered by the fields provided in the array. Data is fetched based on the 'where clause'. The data structures are ordered by the fields provided in the array. 'where clause' should NOT contain the key word 'where'. Note all values have to be within single quotes. 
Example for 'where clause':
  // Raw code
  String whereClause = "SALES_ORDER_TYPE = 'ABC' AND TOTAL_AMOUNT > '10000'";
  
  // Using some constants
  String whereClause = SALES_ORDER_HEADER.SALES_ORDER_TYPE  + " = '" + AppConstants.SALES_ORDER_STANDARD_TYPE + "' AND" 
  					SALES_ORDER_HEADER.TOTAL_AMOUNT + " > '" + totalAmount + "'";

Parameters:
structureName - Table name from where data has to be fetched
whereClause - Where clause to filter data
orderByFields - String[] Array of fields to order the data fetched from the database. If there are multiple fields then the data is ordered according to the array index.
headerDataStructure - Header data structure
Returns:
IDataStructure[] Array of data structure objects from the table
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

getChildren

IDataStructure[] getChildren(java.lang.String structureName,
                             java.lang.String[] orderBy,
                             IDataStructure headerDataStructure)
                             throws DBException
Get all the children structures / items from the child table for the give header data structure. The data structures are ordered by the fields provided in the array. Ex: Get sales order items from table sales_order_items based on sales order header.

Parameters:
structureName - Table name from where data has to be fetched
orderByFields - String[] Array of fields to order the data fetched from the database. If there are multiple fields then the data is ordered according to the array index.
headerDataStructure - Header data structure
Returns:
IDataStructure[] Array of data structure objects from the table
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

getAllChildren

java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,IDataStructure[]> getAllChildren(IDataStructure headerDataStructure)
                                                                      throws DBException
Get all the children structures / items from the children tables for the give header data structure. Ex: Get customer sales areas, customer ship to addresses based on customer header.

Parameters:
structureName - Table name from where data has to be fetched
headerDataStructure - Header data structure
Returns:
Hashtable Hashtable of data structure objects from the children tables. The hashtable contains the child structure / item name as the key and an array of data structures as the value.
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

count

int count(java.lang.String structureName,
          java.lang.String whereClause)
          throws DBException
Get the count of the records in the database table which match the where clause. 'where clause' should NOT contain the key word 'where'. Note all values have to be within single quotes. 
Example for 'where clause':
  // Raw code
  String whereClause = "SALES_ORDER_TYPE = 'ABC' AND TOTAL_AMOUNT > '10000'";
  
  // Using some constants
  String whereClause = SALES_ORDER_HEADER.SALES_ORDER_TYPE  + " = '" + AppConstants.SALES_ORDER_STANDARD_TYPE + "' AND" 
  					SALES_ORDER_HEADER.TOTAL_AMOUNT + " > '" + totalAmount + "'";

Parameters:
structureName - Table name from where data has to be fetched
whereClause - Where clause to filter data
Returns:
int Number of records
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

max

java.lang.Object max(java.lang.String structureName,
                     java.lang.String fieldName,
                     java.lang.String whereClause)
                     throws DBException
Get the maximum value of the required field in the database table which match the where clause. 'where clause' should NOT contain the key word 'where'. Note all values have to be within single quotes. 
Example for 'where clause':
  // Raw code
  String whereClause = "SALES_ORDER_TYPE = 'ABC' AND TOTAL_AMOUNT > '10000'";
  
  // Using some constants
  String whereClause = SALES_ORDER_HEADER.SALES_ORDER_TYPE  + " = '" + AppConstants.SALES_ORDER_STANDARD_TYPE + "' AND" 
  					SALES_ORDER_HEADER.TOTAL_AMOUNT + " > '" + totalAmount + "'";

Parameters:
structureName - Table name from where data has to be fetched
fieldName - Field whose max value is required
whereClause - Where clause to filter data
Returns:
Object Max value - Integer, Long, Float, Double or String based on field type
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

execute

void execute(java.lang.String sqlStatement)
             throws DBException
Executes a single SQL statement that does not return data. SQL statement CANNOT be a SELECT, MAX, MIN, TOTAL, etc. statement.

Parameters:
sqlStatement - Single SQL statement that has to be executed
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

executeBindQuery

void executeBindQuery(java.lang.String sqlStatement,
                      java.lang.Object[] columnValues)
                      throws DBException
Executes a single SQL statement that does not return data. SQL statement CANNOT be a SELECT, MAX, MIN, TOTAL, etc. statement. The values for the fields can be bound using the column values.

Parameters:
sqlStatement - Single SQL statement that has to be executed
columnValues - Column values that have to be bound to the SQL statement
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

executeQuery

android.database.Cursor executeQuery(java.lang.String sqlStatement)
                                     throws DBException
Executes a single SQL statement returning Cursor over the result set.

Parameters:
sqlStatement - Single SQL statement that has to be executed
Returns:
Cursor Cursor to the result set from the database
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible

getTypedDS

<T> java.util.List<T> getTypedDS(java.lang.String tableName,
                                 java.lang.String whereClause,
                                 java.lang.String[] orderByFields,
                                 java.lang.Class className)
                             throws DBException
Get data from the database as "typed" IDataStructure objects for the given table name. The data structures are ordered by the fields provided in the array. Data is fetched based on the 'where clause'. The data structures are ordered by the fields provided in the array. 'where clause' should NOT contain the key word 'where'. Note all values have to be within single quotes. 
Example for 'where clause':
  // Raw code
  String whereClause = "SALES_ORDER_TYPE = 'ABC' AND TOTAL_AMOUNT > '10000'";
  
  // Using some constants
  String whereClause = SALES_ORDER_HEADER.SALES_ORDER_TYPE  + " = '" + AppConstants.SALES_ORDER_STANDARD_TYPE + "' AND" 
  					SALES_ORDER_HEADER.TOTAL_AMOUNT + " > '" + totalAmount + "'";

Parameters:
structureName - Table name from where data has to be fetched
whereClause - Where clause to filter data
orderByFields - String[] Array of fields to order the data fetched from the database. If there are multiple fields then the data is ordered according to the array index.
Returns:
IDataStructure List of the data structure type objects from the table. No need to run a loop and cast.
Throws:
DBException - Throws a DBException if the DB is inaccessible
